Anomalous process resource consumption (.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4688 for process creation events on endpoints and servers. Identify newly created or unfamiliar processes. Cross-reference process names/paths against known legitimate software lists. While direct resource usage isn't in Event ID 4688, flag suspicious processes identified. For flagged processes, initiate further investigation using other tools or logs (if available) to check resource utilization. Use descriptive statistics to establish baseline process behavior and identify outliers in execution frequency or parent-child relationships for unusual processes.

Excessive or unusual network traffic pat.Action: Analyze Zeek conn.log and dns.log for connections to known cryptocurrency mining pool IPs/domains or proxy network infrastructure from internal hosts. Calculate traffic volume, duration, and frequency to these destinations. Use time series analysis to detect sudden increases or persistent high volume traffic to such destinations. Employ correlation analysis to link specific internal source IPs/ports to suspicious network traffic patterns.
